author: jgm
content:
Are there any thoughts on what real-world data blob sizes may look like?  Are there candidates for data blobs out there today in L1 call data, and how big are they?

Starting to consider external storage for beacon nodes (aka blob servers) again, given the potential operational requirements for storing blobs individually for each beacon node when at scale.

author: pk910
content:
yea, I'm doing the same in dora. 
The discussion was more related to the key names & format, so that we could use the same storage for both explorers.
The conclusion was that we're storing blobs to s3 in raw binary format with the versioned hash as key.

author: tokey1475
content: i think arbitrum is pushing very roughly 500k every 5 minutes so a ballpark might be 20k*# of arb size rollups?

author: ppf.
content:
yep, the idea is to just store the raw blobs as value per blobVersionedHash as key in s3
- the explorer has a config-flag for setting the "blob-store-provider", which is just an url-prefix which will be used to transform all blobversionedhashes on the frontend into links to the s3 for downloading the blobs
- the "blob-indexer" will work independent of the explorer, no postgres or bigtable needed (intended to run close to beaconnodes and run multiple instances)
- first implementation: https://github.com/gobitfly/eth2-beaconchain-explorer/blob/master/exporter/blobs.go (see it more as a poc, thinking of improving it by storing an index for every 1024 finalized slots)

author: jgm
content: There's a big difference between each blob being 1MB and each being <100KB in terms of requirements, but I wonder if we need to be worrying about worst (realistic) case.
